biosFiles.name: Atari BASIC ROM
biosFiles.description: Atari BASIC ROM (used by Atari 8-bit computer models).
biosFiles.notes: Used by the atari800 core for Atari 400/800/XL/XE; required depends on selected machine type.

biosFiles.name: Atari 400/800 OS ROM (Rev A)
biosFiles.description: Atari OS ROM (rev A) for Atari 400/800 computers.
biosFiles.notes: Used by the atari800 core for Atari 400/800/XL/XE; required depends on selected machine type.

biosFiles.name: Atari 400/800 OS ROM (Rev B)
biosFiles.description: Atari OS ROM (rev B) for Atari 400/800 computers.
biosFiles.notes: Used by the atari800 core for Atari 400/800/XL/XE; required depends on selected machine type.

biosFiles.name: Atari XL/XE OS ROM
biosFiles.description: Atari XL/XE OS ROM for Atari 8-bit computers.
biosFiles.notes: Used by the atari800 core for Atari 400/800/XL/XE; required depends on selected machine type.

biosFiles.name: Atari 7800 BIOS (Europe)
biosFiles.notes: ProSystem BIOS (Europe).

biosFiles.notes: ProSystem BIOS (USA). Required for Atari 7800 emulation.

biosFiles.description: Atari ST TOS operating system ROM

biosFiles.name: VICE JiffyDOS 1541-II
biosFiles.description: Optional JiffyDOS ROM for VICE core: JiffyDOS_1541-II.bin
biosFiles.notes: Optional: improves disk I/O speed and compatibility when using JiffyDOS in VICE. Place in system/vice.

biosFiles.name: VICE JiffyDOS 1571 repl310654
biosFiles.description: Optional JiffyDOS ROM for VICE core: JiffyDOS_1571_repl310654.bin
biosFiles.notes: Optional: improves disk I/O speed and compatibility when using JiffyDOS in VICE. Place in system/vice.

biosFiles.name: VICE JiffyDOS 1581
biosFiles.description: Optional JiffyDOS ROM for VICE core: JiffyDOS_1581.bin
biosFiles.notes: Optional: improves disk I/O speed and compatibility when using JiffyDOS in VICE. Place in system/vice.

biosFiles.name: VICE JiffyDOS C128
biosFiles.description: Optional JiffyDOS ROM for VICE core: JiffyDOS_C128.bin
biosFiles.notes: Optional: improves disk I/O speed and compatibility when using JiffyDOS in VICE. Place in system/vice.

biosFiles.name: VICE JiffyDOS C64
biosFiles.description: Optional JiffyDOS ROM for VICE core: JiffyDOS_C64.bin
biosFiles.notes: Optional: improves disk I/O speed and compatibility when using JiffyDOS in VICE. Place in system/vice.

biosFiles.name: CMD SuperCPU Kernal 1.4 (VICE optional)
biosFiles.description: CMD SuperCPU Kernal ROM v1.4 for VICE SuperCPU mode. Optional firmware; used only when enabling SuperCPU kernal option.
biosFiles.notes: Libretro VICE docs list this optional ROM and MD5; docs do not provide SHA1/CRC/size. File size from Zimmers.net; libretro docs provide MD5 only (SHA1 not published in source).

biosFiles.name: CMD SuperCPU Kernal 2.04 (VICE optional)
biosFiles.description: CMD SuperCPU Kernal ROM v2.04 for VICE SuperCPU mode. Optional firmware; used only when enabling SuperCPU kernal option.
biosFiles.notes: Libretro VICE docs list this optional ROM and MD5; docs do not provide SHA1/CRC/size. File size from Zimmers.net; libretro docs provide MD5 only (SHA1 not published in source).

biosFiles.name: CD-i BIOS
biosFiles.description: Philips CD-i BIOS files (multiple versions may be needed)

biosFiles.name: Airline Pilots BIOS (Flycast)
biosFiles.notes: BIOS for Airline Pilots (Naomi-derived) in Flycast.

biosFiles.name: Atomiswave BIOS (Flycast)
biosFiles.notes: Enables Atomiswave arcade emulation in Flycast.

biosFiles.name: Dreamcast BIOS
biosFiles.notes: Dreamcast boot ROM. Required for LLE Dreamcast (Flycast) when HLE is disabled.

biosFiles.name: Dreamcast Flash ROM
biosFiles.notes: Required for accurate Dreamcast emulation (flash/EEPROM). Optional: some emulators can operate with HLE flash; real flash recommended for correct region settings and certain features.

biosFiles.name: Ferrari F355 BIOS (Flycast)
biosFiles.notes: BIOS for Ferrari F355 Challenge (Naomi-derived) in Flycast.

biosFiles.name: Ferrari F355 Deluxe BIOS (Flycast)
biosFiles.notes: BIOS for Ferrari F355 Challenge Deluxe (Naomi-derived) in Flycast.

biosFiles.name: House of the Dead 2 BIOS (Flycast)
biosFiles.notes: BIOS for House of the Dead 2 (Naomi-derived) in Flycast.

biosFiles.name: NAOMI BIOS (Flycast)
biosFiles.notes: Enables NAOMI arcade emulation in Flycast.

biosFiles.name: NAOMI 2 BIOS (Flycast)
biosFiles.notes: Enables NAOMI 2 arcade emulation in Flycast.

biosFiles.name: Nintendo 64DD IPL ROM
biosFiles.description: Nintendo 64DD IPL ROM required for 64DD emulation.
biosFiles.notes: Optional unless using 64DD disks; some emulators provide HLE for IPL.

biosFiles.name: Neo Geo AES BIOS (aes.zip)
biosFiles.description: Neo Geo AES (home console) BIOS archive used by Geolith core. Place in RetroArch system directory.
biosFiles.notes: Libretro Geolith docs list required BIOS archive and MD5. SHA1/CRC/size not listed in libretro System.dat; needs verification from DAT/Redump/MAME set. MD5 from libretro Geolith docs; AES zip contents/hashes vary across ROMsets.

biosFiles.name: Neo Geo BIOS
biosFiles.description: SNK Neo Geo AES/MVS BIOS collection

biosFiles.name: PC-FX SCSI ROM (fx-scsi.rom)
biosFiles.notes: Optional unless using SCSI-related peripherals/features; most users only need pcfx.rom.

biosFiles.name: PC-FX BIOS variant (pcfxga.rom)
biosFiles.notes: Alternate BIOS dump; keep only if you specifically need this variant.

biosFiles.name: PC-FX BIOS v1.01 (pcfxv101.bin)
biosFiles.notes: Alternate BIOS dump; verify which titles require it.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (PSP 6.60 extract)
biosFiles.description: Extracted PS1 BIOS from PSP firmware 6.60 (region-free).
biosFiles.notes: Libretro docs list this as a valid replacement BIOS for Beetle PSX and PCSX ReARMed.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (PS3 ps1_rom.bin)
biosFiles.notes: MD5 is documented by Libretro; SHA1/CRC32 still need verification from a DAT or other primary hash list.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (Japan v1.0)
biosFiles.notes: Older BIOS; usually not needed unless targeting early NTSC-J compatibility.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (USA)
biosFiles.notes: Common NTSC-U/C BIOS. PCSX ReARMed can fall back to HLE if no BIOS is found.

biosFiles.name: PSone BIOS (USA v4.x)
biosFiles.description: SCPH-101 - North American PSone BIOS (multiple revisions exist: v4.4 and v4.5).
biosFiles.notes: If you only keep one, v4.5 is usually preferred in reference sets.

biosFiles.name: PSone BIOS (Europe v4.x)
biosFiles.description: SCPH-102 - European PSone BIOS (multiple revisions exist: v4.4 and v4.5).
biosFiles.notes: Some naming schemes call these scph102A/B/C, but they map to BIOS revisions rather than unique contents.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (Japan v2.2)
biosFiles.notes: SHA1 needs verification from a Redump/No-Intro DAT; MD5+CRC32 are from a redump-based guide.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (Japan)
biosFiles.notes: Common NTSC-J BIOS.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (USA v3.0)
biosFiles.description: SCPH-5501 - North American PlayStation BIOS v3.0.
biosFiles.notes: Commonly recommended USA BIOS for PS1 emulation.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (Europe)
biosFiles.notes: Common PAL BIOS used by many EU consoles (incl. SCPH-5552).

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (Southeast Asia v3.0)
biosFiles.description: SCPH-5503 - PlayStation BIOS v3.0 (often identical to SCPH-5501 dump).
biosFiles.notes: Model-to-BIOS mapping varies by source; this entry uses the hash-equivalence noted by common reference sets.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (Europe v3.0 - SCPH-5552)
biosFiles.description: SCPH-5552 - European PlayStation BIOS v3.0 (same content as scph5502 in many sets).

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (Japan v4.0 - SCPH-7000)
biosFiles.notes: SCPH-7000/7500/9000 share the same BIOS in common reference sets.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (USA v4.1 - SCPH-7001)
biosFiles.description: SCPH-7001 - North American PlayStation BIOS v4.1.
biosFiles.notes: Multiple USA console models share this BIOS.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (Europe v4.1 - SCPH-7002)
biosFiles.notes: SCPH-7002/7502/9002 share the same BIOS in common reference sets.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (USA v3.0 - SCPH-7003)
biosFiles.description: SCPH-7003 - PlayStation BIOS v3.0 (commonly identical to scph5501 dump).
biosFiles.notes: Some reference sets treat SCPH-7003 as sharing the scph5501 BIOS.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (Japan v4.0 - SCPH-7500)
biosFiles.notes: SCPH-7000/7500/9000 share the same BIOS in common reference sets.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (USA v4.1 - SCPH-7501)
biosFiles.description: SCPH-7501 - North American PlayStation BIOS v4.1.
biosFiles.notes: Multiple USA console models share this BIOS.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (Europe v4.1 - SCPH-7502)
biosFiles.notes: SCPH-7002/7502/9002 share the same BIOS in common reference sets.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (USA v4.1 - SCPH-7503)
biosFiles.description: SCPH-7503 - North American PlayStation BIOS v4.1.
biosFiles.notes: Multiple USA console models share this BIOS.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (Japan v4.0 - SCPH-9000)
biosFiles.notes: SCPH-7000/7500/9000 share the same BIOS in common reference sets.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (USA v4.1 - SCPH-9001)
biosFiles.description: SCPH-9001 - North American PlayStation BIOS v4.1.
biosFiles.notes: Multiple USA console models share this BIOS.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (Europe v4.1 - SCPH-9002)
biosFiles.notes: SCPH-7002/7502/9002 share the same BIOS in common reference sets.

biosFiles.name: PlayStation BIOS (USA v4.1 - SCPH-9003)
biosFiles.description: SCPH-9003 - North American PlayStation BIOS v4.1.
biosFiles.notes: Multiple USA console models share this BIOS.

biosFiles.name: Sega Saturn BIOS (USA/Europe)
biosFiles.description: Sega Saturn BIOS (USA/Europe) - common BIOS for US/EU Saturn hardware

biosFiles.name: Sega Saturn BIOS (mpr-18100)
biosFiles.description: Sega Saturn BIOS variant (mpr-18100) - alternate BIOS dump

biosFiles.name: Sega Saturn BIOS (mpr-18811-mx.ic1)
biosFiles.description: Sega Saturn BIOS variant (2MB) - alternate dump

biosFiles.name: Sega Saturn BIOS (mpr-19367-mx.ic1)
biosFiles.description: Sega Saturn BIOS variant (2MB) - alternate dump

biosFiles.name: Sega Saturn BIOS (Japan 1003)
biosFiles.description: Sega Saturn BIOS (Japan 1003) - alternate BIOS dump

biosFiles.name: Sega Saturn BIOS (Japan v1.00)
biosFiles.description: Japanese Saturn BIOS (v1.00) - alternate to sega_101.bin
biosFiles.notes: Alternate Japanese BIOS (v1.00) matching saturn_bios.bin.

biosFiles.name: Sega Saturn BIOS (Japan v1.00a)
biosFiles.description: Sega Saturn Japanese BIOS (v1.00a) - alternate BIOS dump

biosFiles.name: Sega Saturn BIOS (Japan v1.01)
biosFiles.description: Sega Saturn Japanese BIOS (v1.01) - commonly required for JP Saturn games

biosFiles.name: Sega CD BIOS (USA CDX v2.21x)
biosFiles.description: Sega CDX North American BIOS (v2.21x, 1993) - additional accepted dump
biosFiles.notes: CDX BIOS variant; verify SHA1/CRC32 from DAT.

biosFiles.name: Sega CD BIOS (USA v1.10 - Model 1)
biosFiles.description: Sega CD North American BIOS (Model 1 v1.10, 1992) - commonly used by PicoDrive
biosFiles.notes: Genesis Plus GX uses a different bios_CD_U.bin MD5 for US Sega CD (see core docs); keep this variant for PicoDrive.

biosFiles.name: Sega CD BIOS (USA v2.00w - Model 2)
biosFiles.description: Sega CD North American BIOS (Model 2 v2.00w, 1993) - required by Genesis Plus GX for US Sega CD games
biosFiles.notes: Hashes other than MD5 still need verification from a DAT/System.dat-style source.

biosFiles.name: Sega CD BIOS (USA v2.11x - Model 2)
biosFiles.description: Sega CD North American BIOS (Model 2 v2.11x, 1993) - additional accepted dump
biosFiles.notes: Additional US Model 2 BIOS variant; verify SHA1/CRC32 from DAT.

biosFiles.name: Sharp X1 IPL ROM
biosFiles.description: Sharp X1 initial program loader (IPL) ROM required by libretro x1 core.
biosFiles.notes: Filename must match exactly (case-sensitive on Linux).

biosFiles.name: Sharp X1 Turbo IPL ROM
biosFiles.description: Sharp X1 Turbo IPL ROM required for X1 Turbo mode in libretro x1 core.
biosFiles.notes: Needed only if using X1 Turbo model; core can run standard X1 with iplrom.x1.

biosFiles.name: BS-X BIOS (English, DRM-free)
biosFiles.notes: Alternative BS-X BIOS dump; enables Satellaview (BS-X) emulation.

biosFiles.name: BS-X BIOS (English)
biosFiles.notes: Enables Satellaview (BS-X) emulation.

biosFiles.name: Super Game Boy 1 ROM Image
biosFiles.description: Super Game Boy 1 cartridge ROM image used by some emulators.
biosFiles.notes: Optional; only needed for SGB/Sufami Turbo/BS-X related functionality.

biosFiles.name: Super Game Boy 2 ROM Image
biosFiles.description: Super Game Boy 2 cartridge ROM image used by some emulators.
biosFiles.notes: Optional; only needed for SGB/Sufami Turbo/BS-X related functionality.

biosFiles.name: Super Game Boy 2 BIOS
biosFiles.description: Super Game Boy 2 boot ROM. Enables SGB2 features in some cores.
biosFiles.notes: Optional; only needed for SGB/Sufami Turbo/BS-X related functionality.

biosFiles.name: Super Game Boy BIOS (SGB1)
biosFiles.description: Super Game Boy boot ROM (SGB1). Enables SGB features/borders in some cores.
biosFiles.notes: Optional; only needed for SGB/Sufami Turbo/BS-X related functionality.

biosFiles.name: SuFami Turbo BIOS
biosFiles.description: Bandai SuFami Turbo base cartridge BIOS.
biosFiles.notes: Optional; only needed for SGB/Sufami Turbo/BS-X related functionality.

biosFiles.name: PC Engine Game Express Card BIOS
biosFiles.description: Game Express CD Card BIOS (same as gecard.pce).
biosFiles.notes: Optional/legacy; System Card 3.0 is recommended for broad compatibility.

biosFiles.name: PC Engine CD System Card 1.0
biosFiles.description: PC Engine CD-ROM² System Card v1.0 BIOS.
biosFiles.notes: Optional/legacy; System Card 3.0 is recommended for broad compatibility.

biosFiles.name: PC Engine CD System Card 2.0
biosFiles.notes: Older System Card; most users should use System Card 3.0 (syscard3.pce) unless targeting older CDs.

biosFiles.name: PC Engine CD System Card 3.0
biosFiles.description: PC Engine Super CD-ROM² System Card 3.0
biosFiles.notes: Most common / preferred System Card for PCE/TG-CD emulation.

biosFiles.name: Vectrex BIOS
biosFiles.description: Vectrex system ROM (not strictly required, built into most emulators)
biosFiles.notes: Hash/size from TOSEC listing; RetroBat expects Vectrex_Bios.bin SHA1 b9bbf5bb…

biosFiles.name: ZX Spectrum 128K ROM 0
biosFiles.notes: Required depends on the machine model you emulate (48K/128K/+3).

biosFiles.notes: Optional: required depends on the specific Spectrum model you emulate (48K/128K/+3/+3e, etc.).

biosFiles.description: MineStorm (built-in game) vector ROM used by some Vectrex setups/frontends.
biosFiles.notes: Hashes match MAME machine XML/TOSEC and RetroBat VEC_MineStorm.vec entry.
biosFiles.name: Vectrex MineStorm Vector ROM

changes: Major expansion from 50 to 319 BIOS entries
Added comprehensive PS1/PS2 model-specific BIOS variants
Added 3DO, PC Engine CD, PC-FX, FDS, Neo Geo CD entries
Added Sharp X1 BIOS entries with xmil subdirectory
Added VICE JiffyDOS and SCPU ROM entries
Added CPS1/CPS2/CPS3 placeholder entries (TODO: authoritative hashes)
Fixed Vectrex BIOS to TOSEC hashes/size
Added new emulator references: geolith, beetle-sgx, xmil
Initial release with 50 core BIOS entries
Fixed vectrex-minestorm entry: renamed displayName to name (schema compliance)
